co.cask.tigon.data.util.hbase
Class ConfigurationTable

java.lang.Object
  co.cask.tigon.data.util.hbase.ConfigurationTable

public class ConfigurationTable
extends Object

Reads and writes current CConfiguration to a table in HBase. This make the configuration available to processes running on the HBase servers (such as coprocessors). The entire configuration is stored in a single row, keyed by the configuration type (to allow future expansion), with the configuration key as the column name, and the configuration value as the value.

Nested Class Summary
static class ConfigurationTable.Type
          Defines the types of configurations to save in the table.

Constructor Detail

ConfigurationTable

public ConfigurationTable(org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration hbaseConf)
Method Detail

write

public void write(ConfigurationTable.Type type,
                  CConfiguration conf)
           throws IOException
Writes the CConfiguration instance as a new row to the HBase table. The ConfigurationTable.Type given is used as the row key (allowing multiple configurations to be stored). After the new configuration is written, this will delete any configurations written with an earlier timestamp (to prevent removed values from being visible).

Parameters:
conf - The CConfiguration instance to store
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while writing the configuration

read

public CConfiguration read(ConfigurationTable.Type type,
                           String namespace)
                    throws IOException
Reads the given configuration type from the HBase table, looking for the HBase table name under the given "namespace".

Parameters:
type - Type of configuration to read in
namespace - Namespace to use in constructing the table name (should be the same as root.namespace)
Returns:
The CConfiguration instance populated with the stored values, or null if no row was found for the given type.
Throws:
IOException - If an error occurs while attempting to read the table or the table does not exist.
